stepTitle: The following Bohr diagram represents the energy levels for ion “x” which contains one electron. When exciting this atom, the electron can then transition from an $$n=2$$ energy state to an $$n=1$$ (ground) energy state to emitting a photon with an energy of $$2.84\times{10}^{\left(-19\right)}$$ J. Calculate the wavelength in nm. Round to two decimal places.
